Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: jcl88
Reviews.Content: the Alexander is technically a 4 star hotel, but it doesn't charge 4 star prices, which is ok as it has seen better days. it has a quiet off street location in an area of Mestre that could not be considered central. However, it is easy to get the bus into Venice, just get your tickets at the tabac beforehand. A local bus around the corner will also get you to the airport very cheaply, 1 euro 30 cents. The longer distance buses to the airport are 5 euros. There are new bars and restaurants over the bridge in a new complex built at the docks.

Reviews.Title: “4 starts?! not even close!”
Reviews.Author: Sergio V
Reviews.Content: Even though the staff was quite nice and helpfull and the breakfast was very complete, the hotel itself was not that good at all. I don't know what kind of rating they were into to be called a 4 stars, but it definetly wasn't a "propper 4 star". During my whole european tour, I've stayed in 2 or 3 three-stars-hotels that were amazingly better than this one. First of all, the lobby decoration was horribly tacky and the elevators were old. The room was "ok"; it was clean and comfortable, but there were no courtains or windows separating the shower from the rest of the bathroom so sometimes it was a bite messy. The mini-bar refrigerator wasn't really working since the 1st time I opened it, because next day, all drinks were a bit warm even though I checked it and was propperly closed. Finally (and most importantly I'm guessing...), this hotel was placed in "Venezia Mestre", which is NOT the typical-touristic Venezia island. To get there, I had to walk about 5 minutes to the bus station and then take a bus ride that took around 15-20 minutes to get to the island, so that made everything a little worst, since it wasn't really easy to get to the interesting area whenever I wanted. And the other detail I wanted to bring up to this review is that I'm pretty sure it was the same guy from the bar that cleaned the rooms... Anyways, I just would like to repeat something in different words: The hotel was OK... It was good enough just for sleeping and maybe staying there for a few hours before going to bed, but if you're expecting a normal 4-stars hotel with all the facilities and nice details they use to have, THIS IS NOT the hotel you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: oks70
Reviews.Content: It looks poor for a four star hotel. Rooms not bad, but bathrooms haven't been renovated for a long time. Tasteless breakfast. Good location, close to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MKM62
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Alexander is a nice little hotel. It is located in a residential neighborhood of Mestre. I felt very safe walking to and from hotel late night. It is not fancy but it is clean. Breakfast was not that impressive. It is easy to get to from the either of Veniceâ€™s two train stations. The hotel staff is nice and helpful. I suggest staying here if you on a budget like I was. The bus stop is only 2 blocks away and the number 12 bus is only a 10 minute ride to Venice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasing comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: mikeandMrsMike
Reviews.Content: Had a great short stay in this hotel, the first on a tour or Italy. We found the staff extremely polite and helpful and honest. Very comortable room, it is outside Venice, but we knew that and the trip in is very accessable, and the staff explain it well. It is worth noting there are good restaurants nearby which are affordable. All in all, would defintely stay here again and recommend it. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Location Just Outside Venice”
Reviews.Author: twocatts
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel just outside Venice - 15 minutes on the bus takes you straight into the Piazza Roma. We chose this hotel as we were travelling with our car and wanted a secure place to park along with easy access into Venice. The hotel is very 1980's in decor (lots of pink and grey) but it was very clean and the service from the front desk was excellent. The breakfast was buffet style with the usual eggs, bacon, cereal, cakes, fruit and yoghurt. The bus stop into Venice was 2 minutes walk from the hotel (the front desk will give you a map of where the bus stop is) - its worth noting that you need the 12 bus, very easy to use running day and night.

Reviews.Title: “A good alternative when visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: Wooders1
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Venice. Because we had our car this time, it was not convenient to stay right in the centre, so instead we stayed at Hotel Alexander in Mestre. Parking at the hotel was free, and the hotel itself was quite modern and clean, and with a bigger room than you would expect if you were staying in Venice itself. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We were able to buy tickets for public transport directly from the front desk, and they directed us to the bus stop which is only a 5 min walk from the hotel. The buses to Piazzale Roma in Venice go past every 10 mins or so, and from P. Roma you can then just hop on a Vaporetto and you're on the Grand Canal! Mestre itself certainly does not have the same charm as Venice, but if you're looking to save money, or have a car with you, then this is a great choice and you're still only 15 mins from all the glory that is this remarkable city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Outside of Venezia”
Reviews.Author: Adriatic_100
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel just outside of Venice, very easy quick bus ride to Venice. Considering the very hefty price of Hotels in Venice this is a nice alternative. In the back street you can purchase bus tickets to Venice for about â‚¬1,00 at a tobacco shop, it is easy to find as you take only one bus #12 to Venice about a 12 min ride with only a few stops on the way, it strait down and simple even if you don't speak Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...but found difficult to reach”
Reviews.Author: ABHIRAI
Reviews.Content: Hi, In my memory....i have just one strange recollection of chasing and finding bus stops....around hotel...(i was dependent on bus ion venice) I traveled by train to mestre station and took bus to hotel.....The hotel mentions...the bus stop 30 mts...it is true but a big catch...is there are 3-4 stops of same name .......as I got down at bus stop via Marghera first time I saw...but was later puzzled.and went searing both ways...for 20 minutes..later the otherday found 3-4 more stops of same name....marked 1/1, 1/2, 1/3 ...and so no...So remember if u go by bus...get down at 2/4 of the Via Marghera stop... Maybe italy venice transport system is the culprit...? but i guess this hotel ....all could provide complete info .... When I complained to staff at reception that ino on wensite was not complete i did not really get a good response.... Then we stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The hotel should be categorized as a 3 stars at best. Rooms was clean and breakfast was quality stuff and quite detailed...... The personel was polite..... So hotel is not bad....The room is large, much larger than I expected. The bathroom is spacious. It was clean and fine... . All in all, not so bad, easy to reach Venice, Nice Indian restaurant around 5 mins walk on main road near the hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnaVu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel should be categorized as a 3 stars max. Our room was very small, the furniture is old, the bathroom is a bit rustily, breakfast very modest and basic. The personel was polite but not so friendly and helpfull. All in all, not so bad, easy to reach Venice, but for the price I would suggest people to find some other accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay outside Venice”
Reviews.Author: DimitriB
Reviews.Content: It is a rather good hotel in Mestre, just outside the town of Venice. You have to catch a bus to reach the beautiful city of Venice. The rooms have enough space and the bathroom looks nice and very clean. Airco is only on during summer. Unfortunately there are no fine restaurants in the neighbourhood. When you canÂ´t effort an expensive 4-star hotel in the center of Venice, this 4-star hotel is a very good alternative one.

HotelInfo.Name: Alexander Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Forte Marghera 193c, 30173 Venice, Italy
